entity_model_features.config.animate_onc: 为每个实体设置一次模型动画

默认情况下启用
此设置使实体模型对每个渲染的实体仅进行一次动画处理
这在游戏中是完全正常的，但是
 物品栏屏幕中可见的生物可能会奇怪地闪烁
 特别是如果它代表您已经可以看到的世界中的真实生物
entity_model_features.config.debug.toolt: 调试选项，有助于解决一些问题
entity_model_features.config.debug_right: Show EMF debug data on entity right click

If enabled, this will print out EMf debug info into
the log and chat when an entity is right clicked.
entity_model_features.config.ebe_config_:
If enabled, this will allow EMF to modify the EBE Mod's config
to disable EBE for certain block entities if that
Block Entity actually has a custom EMF model loaded.
EMF cannot automatically re enable these settings afterwards,
 you will have to do that manually if desired.
entity_model_features.config.force_model: 尽量防止 EMF 模型被覆盖

将尝试强制实体渲染器使用EMF
设置的模型，这可以覆盖其他模组更改的原版模型
这不适用于所有模组
entity_model_features.config.function_ex:
abs(x)
Get the absolute value of a number. Will turn negative numbers positive

acos(x)
Get the arc cosine of x

asin(x)
Get the arc sine of x

atan(x)
Get the arc tangent of x

atan2(y, x)
Get the angle between the positive x-axis and the point (x, y)

catmullrom(k, x, y, z, w)
Interpolates between x and y using the catmull-rom spline function with control points z and w

ceil(x)
Round x up to the nearest whole number

clamp(x, min, max)
Limits a number to be between min and max values

cos(x)
Get the cosine of x

cubicbezier(k, x, y, z, w)
Interpolates between x and y using the cubic bezier spline function with control points z and w

degdiff(x, y)
Returns the shortest angular degree difference between two degree values x and y

easeinback(k, x, y)
Interpolates between x and y using the ease in back function

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeinbounce(k, x, y)
Interpolates between x and y using the ease in bounce function

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeincirc(k, x, y)
Interpolates between x and y using the ease in circ function

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeincubic(k, x, y)

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeinelastic(k, x, y)

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeinexpo(k, x, y)
Interpolates between x and y using the ease in expo function

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeinoutback(k, x, y)

examples here: https://easings.net/

easeinoutbounce(k, x, y)

exp(x)
Get e (Euler's constant) raised to the power of x

floor(x)
Round x down to the nearest whole number

fmod(x, y)
Similar to the % operator, but the returned value always has the same sign as the divisor

frac(x)
Get the fractional part of x (what's behind the decimal point)

hermite(k, x, y, z, w)
Interpolates between x and y using the hermite spline function with control points z and w

if(cond, val, [cond2, val2, ...], val_else)
Select a value based one or more conditions

keyframe(k, a, b, c,...)
Interpolates between values based on the current frame 'k' and the keyframes 'a' is 'k=0', 'b' is 'k=1', 'c' is 'k=2' etc.

keyframeloop(k, a, b, c,...)
Interpolates between values based on the current frame 'k' and the keyframes 'a' is 'k=0', 'b' is 'k=1', 'c' is 'k=2' etc. but loops the animation back to frame 'a' when 'k' is greater than the number of keyframes

lerp(k, x, y)
Linear interpolation between X and Y

log(x)
Get the natural logarithm of x

max(x, y, ...)
Get the largest number from a list of numbers

min(x, y ,...)
Get the smallest number from a list of numbers

pow(x, y)
Get x raised to the power of y

print(id, n, x)
Prints the value "x" every N-th frame

printb(id, n, x)
Prints the boolean value "x" every N-th frame

quadbezier(k, x, y, z)
Interpolates between x and y using the quadratic bezier spline function with control point z

raddiff(x, y)
Returns the shortest angular radian difference between two radian values x and y

random(seed)
Random number from 0 to 1. Providing a seed will always return the same result. The seed is optional

round(x)
Round x to nearest whole number

signum(x)
Get the sign of x (positive or negative)

sin(x)
Get the sine of x

between(x, min, max)
Check if a value is between min and max values

equals(x, y, epsilon)
Compare two float values with error margin

in(x, val1, val2, ...)
Check if a value equals one of several values

sqrt(x)
Get the square root of x

tan(x)
Get the tangent of x

random(seed)
Random boolean true|false. Providing a seed will always return the same result. The seed is optional

catch(x,c,id)
Will return x, however if x is NaN or causes some other animation error then c will get returned instead.
id is optional, if it is added the catch function will print the reason c was used to the game log with this id
Primarily intended for animation debugging, if there is a chance something will trigger this you should really be fixing that instead.

todeg(rad)
Convert radians to degrees

torad(deg)
Convert degrees to radians

wrapdeg(x)
Wraps the degree value x to the range -180 to 180 that it matches

wraprad(x)
Wraps the radian value x to the range -pi to pi that it matches
entity_model_features.config.large_mob_l:
If enabled this will reduce the Level of Detail (LOD)
impact of the above setting according to the mobs size.
Larger mobs will have less noticeable skipped frames
than smaller mobs
entity_model_features.config.lod.tooltip:
Sets the distance at which animations will begin to skip frames,
lower the Level of Detail (LOD), This can help with performance
None = no frame skipping
16 = will skip 1 frame for every 16 blocks distance from player
Lower numbers mean more skipped frames and more performance gain
but of course animations will become more noticeably lower
framerate the closer the LOD distance is set
entity_model_features.config.log_math.to:
将动画计算调试数据打印到日志中
警告：会导致极大的滞后！
打印模型的创建调试数据到日志中
entity_model_features.config.low_fps_lod:
If enabled this will reduce the Level of Detail (LOD)
impact of the above setting according to your fps.
Only applies when below 60 fps as skipped frames
become increasingly noticeable at lower fps
entity_model_features.config.options.too: 基本功能或模组兼容性修复的各种选项
entity_model_features.config.physics.too:
如果启用了 Physics 模组，则只会在死亡时渲染原始的原版模型零件
这部分有效，但不是一个完美的解决方案
this will print out the part information or a complete .jem file
for any model that EMF can access EVERY RELOAD!!
The .jem files can be found in "MC_DIRECTORY/emf/export" after a reload
The .jem files are Blockbench ready with
correct pivots boxes and uvs
Unknown models refers to models not supported by OptiFine CEM
entity_model_features.config.render: 如何呈现自定义模型部件
entity_model_features.config.render.tool:
更改自定义模型零件的渲染方式，这不会影响原版模型零件。
正常 = 正常渲染
绿色闪烁 = 自定义零件将闪烁绿色
轮廓 = 模型零件的轮廓将呈现
禁用 = 自定义模型零件将不渲染
entity_model_features.config.substitute_:
EMF将尝试用原版文件替换 .jem
 模型文件中缺失的部分
entity_model_features.config.texture_ove: 尝试使用 EMF 代码

这将控制 EMF 如何处理具有覆盖纹理集的渲染子模型
例如，如果爬行者模型具有头部子模型的单独纹理
有两种方法可以做到这一点，依靠我的代码，或者依靠 Iris mod 的怪癖
我的代码“有效”，但我不是渲染缓冲区的专家，这可能会导致问题
Iris 怪癖使用非常简单且看似安全/稳定的方法方法，但我被告知它不是预期的 Iris 行为
如果未安装 Iris，Iris 选项将默认为 EMF 代码
这几乎总是应该保持默认值，除非在子模型中调试纹理覆盖
entity_model_features.config.tools.toolt: 帮助模型制作或区分自定义模型的可选工具
entity_model_features.config.update.tool:
Sets how often a mobs model will
update for changes like health & age
Never = never update
Slow = 3-5 seconds
Average = about 1 second
Fast = less than a second
Instant = instant (possible lag with hundred of mobs)
entity_model_features.config.vanilla_ren:
尝试将原版模型与自定义模型一起渲染以进行比较
它不会有动画，因此一些位置可能会有些奇怪。
entity_model_features.config.variable_ex: Age in ticks
True if the entity is swinging its right arm. Note false does not mean the other arm is swinging
True if the entity is swinging its left arm. Note false does not mean the other arm is swinging
The remaining entity angry time in ticks. Starts with 400-780 while agressive, and then counts down to 0 when the target is lost
The start value of anger_time
The current day count
The current day time in ticks (0-24000)
The time the entity is dead. Counts up from 0 to 20
The current dimension. Overworld: 0, Nether: -1, End: 1

Euler's number
2.718281.....

Entity variables are specified in the format "var.<name>" (float) or "varb.<name>" (boolean) 

The name can be any string, for example "var.xyz", "var.last_rx", etc.

The variable is attached to the rendered entity and has a default value 0 or false.

Entity variables are useful for storing animation data between frames.
Entity variables

Constant value
false
The depth of the fluid above and below a submerged entity, 0 if not submerged
The depth of the fluid below a submerged entity, 0 if not submerged
The depth of the fluid above a submerged entity, 0 if not submerged
The time in seconds since the last frame
Head pitch (x Rotation)
Head yaw   (y rotation)
The entity's current health

The distance the entity is above the ground
ground being the highest point below the entity with a collidable block
The time the entity is hurt for. Counts down from 10 to 0

A unique numeric identifier for the entity
always the same for the same entity
If the entity is aggressive towards a player or another entity
If the entity is alive
If the entity is blocking with a shield
If the entity is on fire
If the entity is in its baby state
If the entity is climbing a climbable block or is a spider on a wall
If the entity is crawling
If the entity has the Glowing effect
If the entity is taking damage
If a trident is impaled in the ground
If the entity is inside the GUI
If the entity is being held in your hand
If the entity is in an item frame
If the entity is touching lava
If the entity is touching water
If the entity has the Invisibility effect/NBT tag
If the entity is touching the ground
If the entity is worn on another entity's head
If a parrot is sitting on your shoulder
If the entity is being ridden by another entity
If the entity is riding another entity
If a cat/wolf/parrot is sitting
If a cat/ocelot is sneaking
If a living mob is jumping
If a cat/ocelot is sprinting
If a cat/wolf/parrot is tamed
If the entity is inside water/rain
If the player is right handed
If the entity is swimming
If the entity is gliding
If the game is currently rendering the first person hand
Limb movement speed. Ranges from 0 to 1 (still = 0, sprinting = 1)
Limb animation counter. Counts up in ticks when the entity moves
The entity's maximum health

Model variables are specified in the format
 "<model>.<variable_name>"

The model can be:
 "this" - current custom model
 "part" - the original part model to which the custom model is attached
 "<part>" - original model by part name
 "<id>" - custom model by ID
 "<part>:<sub_id>:<sub_sub_id>:..." - (hierarchical) start with original model by part name, then find children by ID
 "<id>:<sub_id>:<sub_sub_id>:..." - (hierarchical) start with model by ID, then find children by ID

The first model found by part name or ID is used if there are duplicates.
The model search by ID is deep, also when used in a hierarchical specification. 

The hierarchical specification allows model groups (json part models) to be reused for different parts. 
For example one hand model ("shoulder:upper_arm:elbow:forearm:palm:finger[1.5]" can be used for both left and right hand.
The animation can use "left_hand:finger1" for the left thumb and "right_hand:finger1" for the right thumb. 
The intermediate parents in the hierarchical specification can be skipped. 

Variable names
 tx, ty, tz    - Translation x, y, z
 rx, ry, rz    - Rotation x, y, z
 sx, sy, sz    - Scale x, y, z
 visible       - Show model and submodels (boolean)
 visible_boxes - Show model only, does not affect submodels (boolean)
Model part variables
The entity's current movement in the direction they are facing. Ranges from -1 to 1 denoting the Y axis intercept of a unit circle of the players current movement vector. 1 is forward, -1 is backward

The entity's current movement in the direction 90 degrees to the right of their facing direction. Ranges from -1 to 1 denoting the X axis intercept of a unit circle of the players current movement vector.

Not a number
throws an exception during runtime
used for debugging

Constant value
3.1415926
The client players current world position
The client players current world rotation. North is 0
The entities current world position

Render variables
 render.shadow_size
 - The size of the shadow underneath an entity
 render.shadow_opacity
 - How transparent the shadow is
 render.shadow_offset_x, render.shadow_offset_z
 - The location of the shadow
  render.leash_offset_x, render.leash_offset_y, render.leash_offset_z
 - The position of the point the leash attaches to
Render variables
The entities current world rotation. North is 0
The index of the current matching random models rule. Defaults to 0
How far through an attack the entity is. Counts up from 0 to 1
The total game time in ticks, not related to the daylight cycle

Constant value
true
entity_model_features.config.models.enab: Sets whether or not to load the given .jem model file
entity_model_features.config.models.expo:
Exports this model as .jem file to the directory "MC_DIRECTORY/emf/export"
This file can be opened in Blockbench and contains all the necessary data for a custom model
including pivot points, boxes, and UVs
Additional data will also be printed in the log, such as where to put this .jem file for use in a resource pack.
entity_model_features.config.models.arro: arrow.jem & spectral_arrow.jem will not appear here, but are both supported
entity_model_features.config.models.cape: player_cape.jem will not appear here, but is also supported, it is an exact copy of player.jem but only the 'cloak' part
entity_model_features.config.only_client:
If enabled this will only apply custom player models to your own player
ignoring all others in multiplayer
entity_model_features.config.math.explai:
This section provides details on the math functions and variables available for use in EMF custom entity model animations.
Including anything added to EMF from another mod using it's API.
Each function and variable will provide more details when clicked on.
entity_model_features.config.variables.e:
A list of all the math variables currently registered for use in EMF custom entity model animations.
Each variable will provide more details when clicked on.
entity_model_features.config.functions.e:
A list of all the math functions currently registered for use in EMF custom entity model animations.
Each function will provide more details when clicked on.
entity_model_features.title: Entity Model Features
entity_model_features.suffix_property:
Model Suffix (Optional)
matches the last random model suffix number that the entities model was set to
defaults to 0
Example: modelSuffix.1= 2 4 6
§amodelSuffix.<n>=<list>
entity_model_features.rule_property:
Model Rule (Optional)
matches the last random model rule number that the entities model matched against
defaults to 0
Example: modelRule.1= 2 4 6
§amodelRule.<n>=<list>
entity_model_features.var_property:
Entity Variable Float (Optional)
matches the CEM animation variable value of the entity
defaults to 0
Example: (for animation variable 'var.xyz') var.1.xyz= 2 4 6
§avar.<n>.<variable>=<list>
entity_model_features.varb_property:
Entity Variable Boolean (Optional)
matches the CEM animation variable value of the entity
defaults to false
Example: (for animation variable 'varb.xyz') varb.1.xyz=true
§avarb.<n>.<variable>=<true|false>
entity_model_features.global_var_propert:
Global Variable Float (Optional)
matches the CEM animation global variable value
defaults to 0
Example: (for animation variable 'global_var.xyz') global_var.1.xyz= 2 4 6
§aglobal_var.<n>.<variable>=<list>
entity_model_features.global_varb_proper:
Global Variable Boolean (Optional)
matches the CEM animation global variable value
defaults to false
Example: (for animation variable 'global_varb.xyz') global_varb.1.xyz=true
§aglobal_varb.<n>.<variable>=<true|false>
entity_model_features.config.variable_ex:
Global variables are specified in the format "global_var.<name>" (float) or "global_varb.<name>" (boolean) 
The name can be any string, for example "global_var.xyz", "global_var.last_rx", etc.
The variable is globally saved and has a default value 0 or false.
Global variables are useful for storing animation data used by multiple entities.
Global variables
OptiFine part names:
Un mapped part names:
entity_model_features.config.prevent_han: If enabled this will forcibly prevent all custom EMF animations from playing on the first person hand model
entity_model_features.config.models_text:
These are all the models modifiable via EMF
These screens will only show / export information about these models unmodified state
If you want to see the current state of a model you will have to look at the model in game
